intro: Gnaphalium oculus, commonly known as the eye plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant is native to South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It has a creeping growth habit and produces a fine, feathery foliage. Gnaphalium oculus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
